results.title: The Mediterranean
results.creator_credit: Bertand Morin, Christopher Bryson, Joe Wiecha, Marianna Edmunds, Tom Naughton, Nicolas Valcour, Learning Channel, New Dominion Pictures and Quai 32
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Archaeology”.
John Rhys-Davis narrates five excellent episodes which showcases archaeological exploration around the Mediterranean. French divers discover a cave filled with 18,000 year old rock paintings in “A Cave beneath the sea.” The Minoan colony of the island of Thera is shown in “Lost city of the Aegean.” The daily life of ancient Egypt is unlocked in “Forgotten mummies.” After World War 2, Schliemann’s discoveries at Troy, disappeared and the mystery is investigated in “Lost treasures of Troy.” The secret rituals of the women of Lesbos in Ancient Greece is the subject of the final episode entitled “Women of Lesbos.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bertand Morin, Christopher Bryson, Joe Wiecha, Marianna Edmunds, Tom Naughton, Nicolas Valcour, Learning Channel, New Dominion Pictures and Quai 32

results.title: Martin the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A clay animated film for children about a Russian shoemaker who discovers new meanings in life by meditating on on truths. Based on a Leo Tolstoy folktale “Where Love Is, God Is”. The introduction and narration is by Alexandra Tolstoy, daughter of Leo Tolstoy.

results.title: Say a little prayer
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein, Jill Bilcock, Carol Hughes and Flying Films
results.brief_description: Richard Lowenstein’s film “Say a Little Prayer” is an under-rated Australian children’s film about a child’s perspective on the world which adults can enjoy. Eleven year old Seymour is bored during the school holidays, living with his fussy guardian in Richmond. His world changes when he meets the fabulous Angie, a young woman who treats him with respect and loving attention. They begin a friendship which is initially fun until Seymour comes to understand that his friend is a heroin user, and her life not as carefree and safe as he initially believed. Lowenstein’s gift for understanding the specificicities of subculture make this a moving film about families and contemporary dislocation. Sudi de Winter is excellent as Angie and Mickey Camilleri is the shy child Seymour. Co-stars Ben Mendelsohn. Based on Robin Klein’s novel “Came back to show you I could fly” with music by Not Drowning, Waving.

results.title: Blue Mountains: moving memories: 1920's - 1970's
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The National Film and Sound Archive has assembled a superb compilation of historic footage which follows the growth and development of the Blue Mountains, one of the most spectacular natural features of the Australian continent. Original commentary has been retained and music selected by the NFSA has been added to the silent segments. The footage has been gleaned from home movies, documentaries and newsreels and amongst the many items of interest is the feature on Norman Lindsay’s house and garden.

results.title: Buying a safe car. Hazardous poles.
results.brief_description: Buying a safe car, narrated by Rob Gell looks at what happens in an automobile crash to both the occupants and the car. Discusses various safety features in design and accessories and recommends that prospective purchasers examine Crash Test Reports of the car they wish to purchase in order to ascertain its safety. “Hazardous poles” focuses on the issue of pole placement, the legal obligation of councils and authorities in ensuring safe placement and the recommended features in pole design for improved safety.

results.title: Romeo and Juliet (PC)
results.creator_credit: ATTICA Cybernetics, BBC-TV and Harper Collins
results.brief_description: Enter the world of Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet wIth this truly multimedia performance on CD-ROM. Dramatically enhance your understanding of the play as you watch, read and listen in an “Interactive theatre” on your PC. The CD-ROM includes a complete audio performance of the play, which is enhanced by synchronised on-screen text presented with hypertext study notes. It also provides a wealth of information on the language and meaning in Shakespeare, costumes and set-design, as well as background information on the life and times of the Great Bard himself. This is an invaluable resource for students, teachers and anyone interested in exploring one of Shakespeare’s most popular plays. Included in the package are a teacher’s guide to the play, a copy of The Alexander Shakespeare text of the play, and a user guide for the CD-ROM.

results.title: Beyond the mind's eye
results.creator_credit: Michael Boydstun, Steven Churchill and Miramar
results.brief_description: Beyond the mind’s eye offers a compilation of computer animation from around the world. The emphasis is on psychodelic fantasy and “gee wiz” special effects, with original music by Jan Hammer. The viewer is taken on a surreal voyage that explores imaginative visions of a technological future, the outer reaches of the universe and alternate dimensions filled with colour and movement.

results.title: The Sundowners
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The Sundowners stars Deborah Kerr and Robert Mitchum as Paddy and Ida Carmody, migrant drovers who travel 400 miles of Australian outback with 1200 sheep. Despite their devotion to each other and their acceptance of the itinerant life, Ida and their son Sean yearn to settle down on a farm of their own. The Carmody’s own drama is played out against the backdrop of Australia’s startling landscapes; at one moment lush and green and in the next, stark and forbidding. This film is a a testamony to the keen eye of director Fred Zinnemann and the excellent performances of Robert Mitchum and Deborah Kerr. Based on the novel by Jon Cleary.

results.title: Return to Sandakan
results.creator_credit: Raymond Quint, Film Australia National Interest Program and Japan Foundation
results.brief_description: During World War II, Sandakan prisoner of war camp in British North Borneo held nearly 2,500 Allied prisoners. By war’s end, only six survived. The story of the atrocities committed by the Japanese at Sandakan is one of the grimmest of the Pacific War. Shot in Australia, Malaysia and Japan, this documentary recounts the tragic story of prisoners of war and examines the legacy of these events for survivors and their families. Some of the images in this program may be disturbing to some viewers.
